Health Communication: The study and use of communication strategies to inform and influence individual and community health decisions.
Interpersonal & Organizational Communica: The study of communication processes in personal relationships, groups, and complex organizations.
Media & Cinema Studies: The critical analysis of film, television, and digital media, their history, and their effects on society and culture.
Rhetoric & Public Discourse: The study of the art of persuasion and argumentation in public life, from political speeches to social movements.
